data.title: Afternoon round
data.text: Very nice course with nice scenery ,they have nice carts too,there was 2 of us out to play a round by ourselves but they wouldn't let us ,we had to play with 2 other people ,didn't like that at all ,wanted a relaxing round with my father ,so if u want to play as a twosome prob want to go elsewere,nice other than that though

data.title: SECOND  RATE
data.text: Just marginal.  Not at all what I had hoped for or expected.   I don't think I will return again. I did not like the experience . There is nothing more that I can add to this review.  I

data.title: Great public course
data.text: I have played PH since 1997 and it has gone thru many changes.  But it is a beautiful and challenging course.  It does need some landscaping help but they recently hired a new guy who understands the challenge if sun, shade, and 100 year old live oak trees. And the food in Canfields is fsbulous

data.title: Had a deal for 20.00 a person
data.text: Had a great time.  Nice coarse but not fancy.  For what we paid it was a good place to play.Very Close to where we stayed.  For our purposes nice place to play.

data.title: the Ocean Course at Hammock Beach resort
data.text: nice layout. Pace fo play a little slow due to typical resort hackers. The resort owns another course, not on the ocean, called the Conservatory. A Tom Watson design slighly inland, but quite challenging. Befor 1:30, greenfees were $149. After that it dropped to $99 + taxes.

data.title: Very enjoyable course
data.text: This is a fairly challenging course in an attractive landscape. The staff are helpful and friendly. I would recommend Palm Coast GC to friends visiting the area..

data.title: Great Course for Intermediate Player
data.text: This is a great course for the beginner and intermediate player. It's difficult but not intimidating. Lots of sand and just a little water. The greens were in great shape. Great staff. I'd definitely play this course again.
